summary:
I have extended experience as (interim) manager in governmental institutions, managing units for practical research on environment and sustainability and units in the field of executive support and development of policy. All included complex change management activities.
I have a strong problem solving and goal oriented attitude and I have an open, communicative, coaching and supporting way of managing people. 
As consultant I am able to easily gain the trust of relevant parties and to establish the broad basis for implementation of the necessary organisational changes. 
I approach environmental issues –if possible- from the content, based on my environmental technology knowledge and experience in (waste) water treatment.
I am highly interested in sustainable development possibilities for third world countries, also as a result of travelling through countries like Nepal, Latin-America, Sri Lanka, and an assessment mission in Colombia and an internship in Egypt.

school.name: T.U. Eindhoven (Technology University) and L.U. Wageningen (Agricultural University Wageningen).

profile_positions.description:
Skills and expertise

profile_positions.description:
Self-employed consultant for environmental and sustainability policies, organisational development, project and interim management, and coaching. 

Assignments to date:

-	November 2008 – to date
Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (MNP), Bilthoven/Den Haag. Assessment of the mutual general services (like Information Technology) among RIVM
and PBL in preparation of the physical migration of the PBL from Bilthoven to The Hague. 
-	March 2007 – September 2009
Municipality of Wageningen Interim coordinator of department Environment and Sustainability. Coaching of staff, professionalized and improved quality control of activities and products. Prepared and implemented new policy of the municipality on future climate and sustainability (‘Wageningen klimaatneutraal 2030’) and assessment of existing waste materials policy, development of new regulation on waste materials.
-	December 2006 – April 2007
Netherlands Forensic Institute (NFI) The Hague
Assessment and development of internal cost model, resulting in a design of a newcost model in line with internal and external (management) controls, including transparency of risks, personnel and financial consequences
-	January 2006 – November 2006
Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency, Bilthoven, Netherlands
Coached the project manager of a large policy sensitive project in which several research institutes participated.   

-	January 2006 – April 2006
Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (MNP), Bilthoven, Netherlands
Preparation of autonomisation of the agency (MNP) through development of external control and setting up of convenants between owners and commissioning bodies. Development of internal control mechanisms including management contracts and accountability systems.

-	February 2006 – March 2006
Waterschap (Water Board) Groot Salland, Zwolle
Support of European tender procedure for the extension of the wastewater treatment plant, resulting in requirements program.

company.name: National Institute for Public Health and the Environment (RIVM), Bilthoven, The Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Project manager for the RIVM  Agency implementation plan  
Project management  leading up to RIVM’s independent status and transition to a result-oriented costbenefit financial administration. Corporate governance  mechanisms were designed  and agreements set up with the owner (Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports - VWS) and the commissioning bodies. Provided direction in developing and implementing the external and internal Planning & Control Cycle and introducing a costbenefit administration. Training of RIVM staff. 

RIVM was awarded autonomy (Agency status) in January 2004. This was followed by further implementation in developing internal management controls, managing the large restructuring of  executive support services and evaluating the research programme.
